name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

strengths: 90 HP is excellent for a Basic Pokemon
Fetch provides card draw for just 1 energy
Colorless type fits in any deck
Comet Punch can deal up to 80 damage
weaknesses: Fighting weakness is problematic against Hitmonchan
Comet Punch requires 4 energy and is coin-flip dependent
Comet Punch average damage is only 40
No real offensive presence until fully powered
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - accelerates Comet Punch setup
Switch/Scoop Up - work around heavy retreat cost
Any deck needing early game draw
counters: Gust of Wind - trap with high retreat cost

competitiveHistory: Kangaskhan from Jungle saw significant competitive play primarily as a setup Pokemon. Its Fetch attack allowed decks to draw cards while building up the bench, making it valuable in the early game. The 90 HP made it durable enough to survive while fetching. However, Comet Punch was rarely used competitively due to its inconsistency and high energy cost. Kangaskhan was commonly seen in stall decks and as an early game wall in various archetypes.

rulings.ruling: Fetch draws from your own deck. If your deck is empty, you cannot draw and the attack does nothing additional.
Comet Punch requires you to flip all 4 coins. You cannot choose to flip fewer.
If you flip 0 heads on Comet Punch, the attack does 0 damage but is still considered to have been used.
